meanings.sent1: The old rug in the corner looked quite daggy.
meanings.sent2: Her daggy clothes were mismatched and wrinkled.
meanings.sent3: Despite his daggy outfit, he still managed to smile brightly.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a daggy, neglected feel to it.
meanings.sent5: The daggy room was filled with dusty old furniture.

meanings.sent1: The outfit she wore to the party was so daggy.
meanings.sent2: His daggy haircut was out of trend with the latest styles.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked at her daggy hat in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The daggy shoes she wore squeaked with every step.
meanings.sent5: The daggy sweater had holes in awkward places.

meanings.definition: A person who is unfashionable or socially awkward.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a daggy in the midst of all the trendy students.
meanings.sent2: The daggy at the party stood out with his outdated dance moves.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends welcomed the new daggy with open arms.
meanings.sent4: He embraced his inner daggy and wore his quirks proudly.
meanings.sent5: The daggy in the office always had a unique perspective.
